Banner: details overlay

Open Tuesday to Sunday

10 a.m. to 4 p.m.

Heard Museum

2301 N. Central Ave.

Phoenix, AZ 85004

Artboard

Content feature banner

Lead-in

WELCOME TO THE HEARD MUSEUM

Discover 12 galleries of American Indian art and exhibitions, an outdoor sculpture gallery, world-class museum shop and a café to relax and take it all in.

Image with content

Southwest Specialties at the Courtyard Café

The Courtyard Café is proud to serve natural, organic and locally sourced products across a seasonally crafted Southwest-inspired menu. Be sure to try our Tepary Bean Hummus, a local favorite, and our nationally recognized Posolé, which was featured in Bon Appétit magazine. Make sure to save room for dessert – the Fry Bread Sundae is highly recommended.

Surf’s Up

Our Spring/Summer 2023 menu is inspired by the exhibition He’e Nalu: The Art and Legacy of Hawaiian Surfing. Try a Champagne Summer salad with truffle-salted watermelon, blueberries, avocados and more topped with a champagne vinaigrette, or try the garlic shrimp street tacos paired with a prickly pear margarita or glass of wine.

Content sidebar with a title

Coffee Cantina

Our quick-serve café is ideal when you need a coffee or snack before continuing your day at the Heard. The cantina offers a selection of gourmet coffee drinks, smoothies, baked-in-house goodies, grab-and-go salads and wraps to enjoy on our beautiful courtyard patio or take with you to-go.

Exhibitions: current latest list

Stories teaser

Exploring Indigenous Filmmaking with Bobby Wilson

Virtual Art Talk: Watch our Virtual Art Talk featuring filmmaker, actor, and artist Bobby Wilson (Sisseton-Wahpeton Dakota) in conversation with Heard Museum Fine Arts Curator Erin Joyce. Wilson, a founding member of the Indigenous sketch comedy group ‘The 1491s,’ discusses his work on television projects like Rutherford Falls and Reservation Dogs. Note: This video contains […]

In Conversation with Artists Nora and Eliza Naranjo Morse

Virtual Art Talk: Watch the recording of our Virtual Art Talk featuring Remembering the Future artists Nora Naranjo Morse and Eliza Naranjo Morse (Santa Clara Pueblo), moderated by exhibition curator Dr. Ann Marshall. Nora Naranjo Morse, a mixed-media artist and poet, is known for her work in clay, organic matter, and recycled materials, creating forms […]
